title: Madison Beer flashes her underwear in pink lace slip at Demi Lovato's Halloween bash
text:
Her debut album Life Support is set to be released before the end of the year.

And Madison Beer turned heads as she headed to Demi Lovato's Halloween bash at Hyde in West Hollywood with Brooklyn Beckham's ex-girlfriend Hana Cross.

The singer, 20, showed off a liberal amount of flesh in a daring look, donning a pink lingerie inspired dress, while Hana flashed her abs in a black crop top.

Costume bash: Madison Beer was stepping out in style on Saturday, celebrating Halloween early at Catch in West Hollywood with her friends

Madison showed off her underwear in the semi-sheer number, which featured a thigh-skimming hemline.

The brunette beauty completed her look with a pair of platform trainers and white socks, which she pulled up to mid-calf.

The stunning star donned a statement necklace and opted for pretty pastel make-up to complement her costume.

Daring: The singer, 20, showed off a liberal amount of flesh in a daring look, donning a pink lingerie inspired dress

Revealing: Madison showed off her underwear in the semi-sheer number, which featured a thigh-skimming hemline

Madison shot to fame at the age of 13 when Justin Bieber posted a YouTube link to Twitter of her belting out At Last, a 1941 number that was was most famously sung by Etta James on her 1960 debut album At Last!.

Justin, who at that point was already a major celebrity, wrote: 'wow. 13 years old! she can sing. great job. #futurestar'.

Madison explained to Teen Vogue back in 2017 that Justin has, in the intervening time, 'become a good friend' of hers.

Cool: The brunette beauty completed her look with a pair of platform trainers and white socks, which she pulled up to mid-calf

She said: 'I think we’ve been able to connect because we were both discovered on YouTube and have a common understanding just from that.'

It took until 2018 for Beer to get around to releasing her first EP, As She Pleases.

On November 9, 2018, she released Hurts Like Hell featuring Offset and this past May released Dear Society, a single from her yet-to-be-released debut album.
